intro: Cybianthus deltatus, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal areas of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, often found in dunes or along the coast. Its delicate appearance and seasonal blooming make it a notable species in coastal ecosystems. Cybianthus deltatus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
